blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Family Matters
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Yu0mBQ

by jeta

“Face it, we suck as a team,“ said Iron Man. "You and I do, I mean.”

Steve struggled to articulate anything at all, and Tony took advantage of his silence.

“So, effective immediately, I’m quitting the Avengers,” continued Iron Man, lifting his helmet and revealing a rather-banged-up-looking Tony Stark. His eyes were tired. His face was white were it wasn’t caked in dried blood. Without his helmet, his voice sounded like he hadn’t used it in ages, incredibly thin and hoarse, almost inaudible. “Tell the others I wish them all well. No hard feelings. Good luck, Cap… and godspeed to you.”

[TAKES PLACE SHORTLY AFTER CIVIL WAR]

Words: 700, Chapters: 1/10, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, James "Bucky” Barnes, Peter Parker, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton
  • Relationships: Avengers Team - Relationship

blog.name: kitcat992

blog.description: As fresh as a bag of wilting lettuce. Female, tired, East side represent. I'm here to scream about fandoms. Fair warning, I cry a lot about fictional characters.

tags: I still gotta get mad about Bruce
I don't let myself feel much these days
summary: The slow, painful process of moving on from Avengers: Endgame is truly a funny one. Because every day I tend to wake up a little...
body:
The slow, painful process of moving on from Avengers: Endgame is truly a funny one.

Because every day I tend to wake up a little less angry about one plot, only to be viciously angry at another.

Starting to get over Tony’s death? Lol nope, now I’m mad about the disrespect to Steve’s character.

Slowly starting to move past the giant shit they took on Steve’s character? Now I’m pissed about how they threw away all of Thor: Ragnarok in favor of fat jokes and making Thor a Guardian instead of the King of Asgard.

Dissociating from that hot mess? Lmao nah fam, now I’m a fuming ball of anger over how Natasha’s character development was thrown off a cliff with her so a serial killer could go back to his family.

Which reminds me, I haven’t really steamed about Clint yet. I’m sure that’s what I’ll be mad about tomorrow. 😒 This is why I feel it’ll take a whole year to get over this atrocity. There’s so much to unpack…

summary: I'm curious how you see the Tony/Steve relationship/conflict moving forward in run verse. It feels so different just because of...
question: I'm curious how you see the Tony/Steve relationship/conflict moving forward in run verse. It feels so different just because of Darcy - Tony hopefully has a bit more peace in terms of underlying issues he had about Howard's obsession with Captain America after the time travel, and perhaps Steve understands Tony better because he is such good friends with Darcy. But maybe not that different? Thanks!
answer:
I hope they don’t conflict too much, honestly. Not beyond maybe natural conflicts. I think sometimes Tony is a little awkward around Steve, because of the ghost of Howard. He might feel a little competitive with Steve, maybe for the same reasons, but also competing for Darcy’s time a bit. I tried to show that a bit in “Sons & Daughters” where Tony was thrilled that of all the people Darcy could have talked to, she talked to him, and kind of got the chance to one-up Steve about it. But, then he also kind of felt bad for Steve who was just trying to help. EMOTIONS! SO CONFUSING!

I see them both as leaders. They’re very different kinds of leaders, but they both do have a sense of responsibility and duty. They approach those things differently, so there is conflict. And they’re both really stupid stubborn and certain they’re right. So … that’s a recipe for arguing. 

But, I think there’s a lot of respect there, too. And I do think Howard’s ghost, and Tony’s childhood issues, are not as present or raw as they are through, say, the first half of the MCU. There was resolution to some of that, Darcy meeting and knowing Howard herself helps. So, some of that understandable abrasiveness towards Captain America doesn’t need to be there. 

I’d like fewer big, titanic struggles between them, and more bickering in Tony’s workshop, or in training sessions and meetings, because they do have different approaches, but it doesn’t need to come to blows.

blog.name: lotsoffandomimagines
blog.title: ✎ Just Imagine It ✎
blog.description:
☆ masterlist → rules → fandom list → about → fav imagines ☆
Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary:
Requested by @lordparadox 
You didn’t realize Tony had an ulterior motive for being the team to Disneyland until after you...
body:
Requested by @lordparadox

You didn’t realize Tony had an ulterior motive for being the team to Disneyland until after you arrived at the park. The entire time you were moving from ride to ride Tony did little things to make it so you and Rhodey were closer together. Like he’d force the two of you to sit next to each other on rollercoasters, bumping into you so you’d end up tripping into Rhodey’s arms. Not only that but all the suggestive comments Stark kept dropping made it pretty obvious what he was trying to pull.

“I’m sorry about Tony” Rhodey eventually apologized to you as you stood near Cinderella’s castle, waiting for the fireworks to commence. “I really don’t know what’s gotten into him” he continued, scratching his head in confusion. “I hope he didn’t ruin your vacation or anything”.

A laugh escaped your lips at this. “Don’t worry about that. He hasn’t ruined anything… in fact” you said, suddenly taking Rhodey’s hand in yours. “Spending all this time with you has made this all worth it and when you think about it, that’s all thanks to Tony”.

Rhodey eventually started smiling at you, then you paused and a moment of meaningful silence fell over the both of you. Before you could really think about anything else, the two of you leaned forward connecting your lips. As if your kiss was the match that lit the fireworks, booms erupted in the background. However you couldn’t be bothered to even look at the colourful explosions in the sky because you would too focused on the man in front of you.

“Finally!” Tony yelled from a little ways away, making you and Rhodey laugh as you pulled away. “I knew my hard work would pay off in the end!”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

Before you could really think about anything else, the two of you leaned forward connecting your lips. As if your kiss was the match that lit the fireworks, booms erupted in the background. However you couldn’t be bothered to even look at the colourful explosions in the sky because you would too focused on the man in front of you.

“Finally!” Tony yelled from a little ways away, making you and Rhodey laugh as you pulled away. “I knew my hard work would pay off in the end!”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

trail.content_raw:
Requested by @lordparadox

You didn’t realize Tony had an ulterior motive for being the team to Disneyland until after you arrived at the park. The entire time you were moving from ride to ride Tony did little things to make it so you and Rhodey were closer together. Like he’d force the two of you to sit next to each other on rollercoasters, bumping into you so you’d end up tripping into Rhodey’s arms. Not only that but all the suggestive comments Stark kept dropping made it pretty obvious what he was trying to pull.

“I’m sorry about Tony” Rhodey eventually apologized to you as you stood near Cinderella’s castle, waiting for the fireworks to commence. “I really don’t know what’s gotten into him” he continued, scratching his head in confusion. “I hope he didn’t ruin your vacation or anything”.

A laugh escaped your lips at this. “Don’t worry about that. He hasn’t ruined anything… in fact” you said, suddenly taking Rhodey’s hand in yours. “Spending all this time with you has made this all worth it and when you think about it, that’s all thanks to Tony”.

Rhodey eventually started smiling at you, then you paused and a moment of meaningful silence fell over the both of you. Before you could really think about anything else, the two of you leaned forward connecting your lips. As if your kiss was the match that lit the fireworks, booms erupted in the background. However you couldn’t be bothered to even look at the colourful explosions in the sky because you would too focused on the man in front of you.

“Finally!” Tony yelled from a little ways away, making you and Rhodey laugh as you pulled away. “I knew my hard work would pay off in the end!”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

description:

Chapters: 1/1 Fandom: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies) Rating: Teen And Up Audiences Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Clint Barton, Natasha Romanov (Marvel) Additional Tags: Alpha/Beta/Omega Dynamics, Omega Tony Stark, Alpha Steve Rogers, Protective Steve Rogers, frist date, Mating Cycles/In Heat, Social Issues, Fluff and Angst, Tony Stark Does What He Wants Summary:


Steve Rogers had never considered himself one of those Alphas who easily got jealous and protective over their Omega, even if they could hold their own. And then he met Tony Stark. / Or: Omega!Tony’s and Alpha!Steve’s relationship throughout the years.

summary: I’ve just read this from Markus McFeely and it really pissed me off. “We’ve been with Steve Rogers since his first movie and to...
body:
I’ve just read this from Markus McFeely and it really pissed me off.

“We’ve been with Steve Rogers since his first movie and to see him finally get some measure of peace … I mean, as upright and upstanding a character and as relatively positive as he is, he’s had nothing but sacrifice. He has put himself aside at every turn. And to feel that satisfaction of him finally going back and getting with Peggy and experiencing that makes me very happy.”

He’s basically admitted the ending of Endgame was made just so that they could fanboy over it later. I love Steve, but will forever maintain that this ending was ooc for him, and that if anyone deserved that ending, it was Tony. 

‘he’s an upright and upstanding character’. Tony has:

  • dropped making weapons the moment he learnt how they were being used
  • been a philanthropist
  • stood up to terrorists (the Mandarin) when everyone else was too scared to
  • went to a random village in a random country (Gulmira) to save it from terrorists just because he could
  • worked with the legit United Nations
  • revolutionised renewable energy
  • funded scientific research of how knows how many broke MIT students
  • worked with the FBI to stop Bad Guys using alien guns
  • mentored a 15 year old jackass to make sure that he would do good as a superhero and stay safe doing it
  • (as evidenced by his appearance at the Funeral) mentored Harley - a random kid he met in a random town on a random occasion just because the kid was living a pretty shit life 
  • saved god knows how many lives as Iron Man

‘he’s had nothing but sacrifice’ and ‘He has put himself aside at every turn.. Hold my beer. Tony has:

  • almost love the love of his life when saving the world from the Mandarin
  • lost his home when saving the world from Mandarin (he’s loaded - but a home is a home, not just a house)
  • lost Jarvis to Ulton when trying to protect the world from Thanos
  • lost his adoptive father (Obie) when he became Iron Man
  • almost lost his best friend when Rhodey fell 
  • almost died trying to save New York
  • completely lost any semblance of mental health he ever had because he saved New York
  • lost the comfort and safety of being an ordinary, boring human when he decided to be a superhero and help people
  • lost most of his friends when they turned on his for doing what was (with the benefit of hindsight now) clearly the right thing for the world
  • again scarified his comfort and safety when he stood up to Ross to protect his friends
  • literally launched himself into space - faced his greatest nightmare - to help save the planet from Thanos
  • single-handedly fought what was arguably the most powerful being in the universe to save everyone when he could have just hidden away
  • further sacrificed his comfort and safety when he agreed to help the Avengers with the Time Heist
  • literally died to save the fucking universe fuck you marvel thanks goodbye


I don’t care about Steve’s ending that much at this point - I’ve resorted to just being happy for him because I like him. But don’t you ever try to tell me he was more deserving of a happy ending than Tony.
